message_1: What is the coordination number of sodium ion (Na+) in the sodium chloride crystal structure and how many nearest neighbors does a sodium ion have?
message_2: In the sodium chloride (NaCl) crystal structure, each sodium ion (Na+) is surrounded by six chloride ions (Cl-) in an octahedral arrangement. Therefore, the coordination number of the sodium ion (Na+) in the sodium chloride crystal structure is 6. This also means that a sodium ion has 6 nearest neighbors.
